import { DropDownImage } from "/src/components/Images";


# Drop Down
Toggles allow user to turn an option on or off.

<div style={{backgroundColor: 'white', borderRadius: 16, padding: 32, marginBottom: 24}}>
   <DropDownImage />
</div>

```xml
<com.waresix.lib.ui.component.molecule.DropDownMV
	android:id="@+id/ddTest"
	app:drop_down_hint="Pilih kategori"
	android:layout_width="match_parent"
	android:layout_height="wrap_content" />
```

fill the dropdown data item
```kotlin
val list = ArrayList<String>()
for (i in 0..4) {
	list.add("isi ke ${i + 1}")
}
val adapter = ArrayAdapter(
	context,
	R.layout.item_dropdown,
	list
)
ddTest.adapter = adapter
```

here is the sample of the layout item : 

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<TextView xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:orientation="vertical"
    android:id="@android:id/text1"
    style="@style/Text.Body.Medium"
    android:textColor="@color/grey70"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:paddingTop="13dp"
    android:paddingBottom="16dp"
    android:paddingHorizontal="24dp"/>
```

to add action on item clicked, you can add code below
```kotlin
ddTest.onItemClickListener = AdapterView.OnItemClickListener { _, _, position, _ ->
	// TODO: your code here
}
```
